item.title: [Python] Introduction to Deep Learning-Coding Preparation-
item.description: # Target audience It is a continuation of Last article. This article prepares for coding from now on. If you want to implement it yourself, but it is quite … please take a look. (Basically, I can’t use complicated techniques, so don’t worry.) ** The coding environment is jupyter notebook. ** If you want to manage it at the module level elsewhere, uncomment the command such as import. If it doesn’t work please let me know in the comments… Next article here

item.title: [Python] List of activation functions (2020)
item.description: # Target audience I summarized what kind of activation function there are. **Latest Swish and Mish, plus tanhExp! ** I’m targeting a layer where I can’t find something good even if I search the list. New ones will be added as soon as they are found. If you have information on new functions or functions on the TODO list below, please let us know! #TODO list Look up additional information for the hardShrink function Look up supplementary information of softShrink function Check supplementary information of Threshold function Look up supplementary information of logSigmoid function Look up additional information for the tanhShrink function Look up additional information for hardtanh function Check supplementary information of ReLU6 function Look up additional information for CELU function Check the supplementary information of the softmin function Look up additional information for the logSoftmax function Examine some unimplemented functions -Pytorch -What is the MultiheadAttention function -Learning method of PReLU function -Implementation of RReLU function -What is the cumulative distribution function that appears in the GELU function?

item.title: [Python] Generate physically robust shapes with GAN and print on a 3D printer
item.description: # 0. What makes me happy about this article You can see the flow of printing the data generated by deep learning on a 3D printer (10. In the experimental code, I have posted it to GitHub for all the codes **. The same thing can be done if you make an environment by git clone It should be easy.I wrote in herehowtocreatetheenvironment.) It becomes a study of material mechanics (I am writing while studying…) Learn how TensorFlow 2.

item.title: [Python] A memorandum of studying and implementing deep learning
item.description: # Target audience A person who has studied machine learning and deep learning in general, but who does not know how they are related when implementing. Someone who wants to organize their mind. I will not give a detailed mathematical explanation. See the chainer tutorial for a mathematical explanation. What became a model of deep learning Deep learning was created by imitating the mechanism of information transmission in human nerve cells.

item.title: [Python] 5 Data Science Masterpieces You Can Learn for Free [Japanese books are not scared if you can speak English even if they are expensive]
item.description: #Let's study by this time There are many generous organizations overseas, or there are many specialized books that can be read for free. There are other summary articles of this series, I would like to display translated Japanese books and original books side by side. Especially introduced only in the field of data science. Maybe that expensive original book is actually free? (As of May 2020) #1 Japanese: Basics of statistical learning (15,000 yen) It’s commonly called a “castella book.

item.title: [Python] AI engineers want to be aware of Python implementation know-how / tips summary
item.description: This article summarizes the points, tips, and know-how that data scientists and AI engineers should be aware of when implementing programs in Python. ● May 16, 2020: Added Book: Self-propelled programmer author: Mr. Shimizukawa, provided detailed explanations to this article and answers to my questions. Click this link to move to the comment. We published a book in April 2020. [Qiita] I wrote a book that teaches a good balance between machine learning implementation and algorithms

item.title: [Python] I wrote a book that teaches a well-balanced implementation of machine learning and algorithms.
item.description: I wrote a book that uses the scikit-learn library to teach a well-balanced implementation of machine learning and algorithms. Introduction to machine learning for people aiming to become AI engineers, learning the algorithm flow while implementing it (Dentsu International Information Service Takuya Shimizu, Yutaro Ogawa, Technical Review) https://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4297112094/ It has already been released. Machine learning ・Implementation of various algorithms ・Mechanism of operation of each algorithm I wrote this for those who want to learn these.

item.title: [Python] Anyway, I gathered a site where you can learn basic free Pythonmachine learning
item.description: #Introduction I will introduce the sites that I collected by surfing the net with only the name, link and a brief description. (Add links etc. at any time) I would be happy if you could introduce the site in the comments. We do not include famous sites such as Progate and dot installation. We also introduce a blog. Please note that the contents are not explained. Let’s go. #Codeprep Format: Exercise Price: All free Learning scope: Basic grammar, data manipulation, NumPy, Pandas, OOP It is a fill-in-the-blank format and does not require environment construction.

item.title: [Python] Check your squat form with deep learning
item.description: **The video used in this article was recorded a long time ago, and I currently refrain from exercising at the gym. ** #Introduction This is the second edition of “Muscle Training x Deep Learning”. The first is here (Deep learning made it easier to see the time-lapse of physical changes). “Form check” that many trainees (people who love muscle training) have become habitual. You can fix your smartphone during the training, take a selfie, and look back later to know the habit of your form and improve the quality of your training afterwards!

item.title: [Python] Transform a real ferocious crocodile image into a 100 crocodile-smiling neural style with Keras
item.description: #What is neural style conversion? Neural style conversion is one of the machine learning techniques that transforms a target image into the style (texture) of another image to generate a new image. It’s a technology used in apps that change Van Gogh’s image of a city or people. Now, let’s try using this technology to see if this time we can transform a real, ferocious crocodile image that seems to eat humans into a gentle crocodile crocodile by transforming its style into a crocodile style that will die 100 days later.

item.title: [Python] 9 steps to become a machine learning expert in the shortest time [Completely free]
item.description: ## Introduction I don’t think you need to do Steps 1, 2 and 7 if you don’t have time. 1. Learn statistics Acquisition of Level 2 statistical test 2. Know the principle of ML Machine Learning -coursera Outline of gradient descent optimization algorithm 3. Learn Python Python -Google 4. Learn the basics of ML Machine Learning Crash Course

item.title: [Python] Deep learning made it easy to see the time-lapse of physical changes
item.description: #Introduction “Self-portraits (body)” that many trainees (people who love muscle training) have become accustomed. It’s blissful to take a picture of your pumped body after training and look back later. In addition, if you display the captured image in animation like a time lapse, you can understand that muscle growth is more like a hand! This article uses deep learning to drastically make it easier to see the timelapse of the body.

item.title: [Python] Why Deep Metric Learning based on the Softmax function works
item.description: #Introduction In distance learning (metric learning) using deep learning, similarities (and dissimilarities) between images are used by using Contrastive Loss and Triplet Loss.) Is widely used, but it is also known that it is difficult to combine and select learning data, and learning itself is difficult in many cases. For that reason, various improvements and ideas have been proposed so far. However, recently, metric learning, which can learn based on the Softmax function as if it is a general class classification task without the difficulty of selecting learning data like this, has been attracting attention.

item.title: [Python] 40-year-old engineer manager passed Deep Learning for ENGINEER
item.description: ## What is Deep Learning for ENGINEER Please note that this article is current as of January 2020. Currently, the following official qualifications are available to prove AI skills in Japan. JDLA Deep Learning for GENERAL (G test) JDLA Deep Learning for ENGINEER (E qualification) is. Positioned as a test, the G test asks general education about AI-related technology. E-qualification is an exam that understands the theory of AI-related technology and asks the skills to implement AI.

item.title: [Python] New Data Augmentation? [Grid Mix]
item.description: #Introduction You might think, “Grid Mix? I’ve never heard of it.” That’s right. Inspired by GridMask and CutMix I made it without permission It is an Augmentation as shown below. I’ve tried it a little to see if it works, so leave it as a memo. Overview Purpose: what you did ** The effect of GridMix described above was confirmed with cifer10. ** **Compared with CutMix which is the same series of Augmentation.

item.title: [Python] Books on data science to read in 2020
item.description: >This article was published in November 2019 by [Przemek Chojecki](https://towardsdatascience.com/@pchojecki),[[DataScienceBooksyoushouldreadin2020](https://towardsdatascience.com/data-science-books-you-should-read-in-2020-358f70e1d9b2)”. This article is published with the permission of the original author. Data science is arguably one of the hottest markets right now. Almost all companies are looking for or considering a data science role. So it’s a great time to become a data scientist. Or if you’re already a data scientist and want to promote to a senior position, it’s a great time to hone your skills.

item.title: [Python] Continue making stock price forecasting AI for 10 hours a day 1st month
item.description: I resumed learning Python last December 3rd. I was wondering if I could make something for practice, but I came up with the idea of creating an AI for stock price forecasting, so I decided to give it a try. As a result, we have AI that can predict (and possibly even predict) that stock prices will rise or fall by more than 1% with 64% accuracy. Project 1 is the main subject because of the process of getting into the main subject of Project 1.

item.title: [Python] How to use machine learning for work? 03_Python coding procedure
item.description: ## Introduction So far, I’ve delivered an article with the theme “How to use machine learning for work?” In this third installment, we will introduce concrete programming under the theme of “Python coding procedure”. If you also read the back number, you can understand the whole from machine learning basics to Python coding, so please use it. Part 1: Understanding the purpose of machine learning Part 2: Overview of AI development project Since various information is also sent on SNS, please feel free to read the article.

item.title: [Python] Full disclosure of methods used in machine learning
item.description: ## Introduction There are increasing opportunities for anyone to learn machine learning, such as kaggle and learning sites. On the other hand, I feel that there are many people who have too much information and don’t get the overall feeling. Therefore, I will publish the methods used in machine learning introduced in various reference books and articles. Please refer to that link for detailed coding. Since various information is also sent on SNS, please feel free to read the article.

item.title: [Python] How to use machine learning for work? 02_AI development project overview
item.description: ## Introduction I am writing a series on the theme “To use machine learning for work”. In this second article, I will organize how AI development projects proceed. The chapters are as follows. What is the difference between AI development and machine learning? Overview of AI development Where to use machine learning in AI development? Steps to build the model What is machine learning? If you feel that your understanding of is suspicious, you should read “Part 1: Understanding the Purpose of Machine Learning”.

item.title: [Python] I tried moving food with SinGAN
item.description: #Introduction I have disturbed the empty frame of Production/Counting Advent Calendar 2019. I’ve been playing around with SinGAN a lot lately, so I’ll try to summarize the results. SinGAN is a paper that became a hot topic because it was selected as the best paper at ICCV 2019. It’s great for learning with just one image and generating images of any size with the same features. ![Screenshot from 2019-12-24 18-23-29.

item.title: [Python] How to use machine learning for work? 01_Understand the purpose of machine learning
item.description: Hello everyone. I started Qiita from today. As a machine learning engineer, I am usually involved in AI development and web application development. In private, I became a newbie daddy. I am writing an article while holding my eldest son who will be 4 months (laugh) As a motivation to write an article, I have been working on machine learning since 2017 when there was no reference book yet, I always feel that the experience of having a hard time learning machine learning is useful for someone.

item.title: [Python] What ICCV2019 Best paper SinGAN cannot do [Practice]
item.description: #Introduction This article is an entry of CyberAgent20 new graduate engineer Advent Calender 2019 on the 18th day. I am a graduate student doing computer vision research using deep learning. twitter → https://twitter.com/revi_matsu This time, it is SinGAN practice that won the best paper at ICCV2019 held the other day. How to read this article [For those who want a rough overview] Read this article. [For those who want to know the specifications a little] This article →I briefly read “SinGAN” and summarized it [For those who want to know the details] This article → “SinGAN” I read it briefly and summarized it→Papers

item.title: [Python] Recommended learning order for beginners of machine learning and deep learning
item.description: # Target of this article Purpose of writing the article The words AI and deep learning have been around for a long time, but I don’t think there are many people who really understand their meaning. I think it’s very dangerous to have a debate about what AI can do, as in Japan today. I think the reason why there is such a debate about AI in this way is that you do not fully understand the mathematical basis of machine learning.

item.title: [Python] [Verification] There is no easy way to exceed 100% recovery rate for horse racing just because it is deep-planned.
item.description: # Now, the beginning of the mystery solving Original article: With a deep learning, the recovery rate can exceed 100% in horse racing First try to move I will purchase the program and try it. As described in the explanation, basically it worked with copy and paste, but the following two places did not work as they are, so I fixed it here. Parsing date data Column names of features used for learning and inference It doesn’t look exactly the same because it contains random elements, but the graphs also moved in roughly the same way, so it seems to have been reproduced.

item.title: [Python] With deep learning, you can exceed 100% recovery rate in horse racing
item.description: ![4370674310_b118d0f62a_c.jpg](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/280076/a136d9bb-956d-2b10-6418-85302ddbbc07.jpeg) pohotos by Ronnie Macdonald It’s been a while since I was told that “AI takes away human work” **, but now some people say that “I’m in a period of disillusionment” **. Thanks to that, I was not robbed of my work, and I am swayed by a crowded train every day. The scams that rob you are also a good thing. While the development of such AI seems to take a little longer, it is now easy to obtain an environment for learning.

item.title: [Python] Build your own PC for deep learning
item.description: Leave a memorandum of your own PC. Finally, I will describe up to the point where Ubuntu is installed and a deep learning environment is created with docker. table of contents Find out how to make your own PC Assemble the PC Environmental construction 1. Find out how to make your own PC I referred to the following sites. -Summary by budget for own PC -How to make a deep learning PC It seems that it is better to decide the specifications according to the application.

item.title: [Python] Score-CAM implementation with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM
item.description: # Overview Implemented the method “Score-CAM” of Paper posted on arxiv on October 3, 2019 with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM, Grad-CAM++. Implemented the independently accelerated Faster Score-CAM. Applied to the model trained on DAGM dataset. The code can be found on github. What is # Score-CAM? One of the visualization methods of the basis of judgment of CNN -There is a wonderful summary on here for understanding the judgment basis.

item.title: [Python] (Saved version: updated from time to time) A collection of useful tutorials for doing data analysis hackathons by Team AI
item.description: We at Team AI hold machine learning study sessions and data analysis hackathons every day in Shibuya. The goal is to have a community of 1 million people, mainly in Tokyo. I hope this movement of data analysis will spread throughout Japan and around the world. We have put together a useful tutorial for doing data analysis hackathons. It’s a lot of fun, so everyone, especially the locals, should try it out for yourself!

item.title: [Python] From environment construction to deep learning tutorial
